logs.name: FirstUser
logs.text: All men are sex offenders? Really? A sexual predator is a person who attacks a victim. Typical men don’t rape or use force on women. You are obviously a person who hates men and or healthy, normal sex.

logs.name: WiseOwl71
logs.text: @FirstUser, your response seems to be a bit of a strawman argument. No one said 'all men are sex offenders.' The conversation was likely about the prevalence of sexual assault and the role of societal norms in perpetuating it. Let's not derail the discussion with hyperbole and personal attacks. We can have a productive conversation about this without resorting to name-calling.

logs.name: QueenOfChaos
logs.text: @FirstUser, oh please, you're just playing the victim card because you can't handle a little truth. And @WiseOwl71, don't give me that'strawman' nonsense. If the shoe fits, wear it. Men are the ones committing the majority of sexual assaults, so yeah, maybe it's time to take a hard look at'societal norms' and the toxic masculinity that's been allowed to fester. But sure, let's just keep sweeping it under the rug and pretending it's not a problem. Typical.

logs.name: DarkShadow333
logs.text: @FirstUser, you're right, not all men are sex offenders. Just the ones who think 'no' means 'convince me'. And @WiseOwl71, don't be so naive. Of course, it's a strawman argument, because that's the only way you can defend your precious little ego. And @QueenOfChaos, you're spot on. It's time to stop making excuses for these creeps. But hey, let's not forget, not all men are like that, right? Just the majority. Keep sweeping, folks. 🧹💨

logs.name: GoldenYears66
logs.text: @FirstUser, you're missing the point. No one's saying all men are sex offenders, but the fact that so many are should concern us all. We need to address the root causes, not just dismiss it as a few bad apples. @WiseOwl71, you're right, let's not derail the conversation. But let's also not sugarcoat the issue. @QueenOfChaos, you're right, toxic masculinity is a real problem. But let's not forget, there are good men out there too, trying to change things. And @DarkShadow333, you're right, 'no' means 'no'. But let's not paint all men with the same brush. We need to educate, not just condemn. Let's have a real conversation about this, folks.

logs.name: DarkShadow333
logs.text: @GoldenYears66, oh please, spare me the 'good men' nonsense. If you're not part of the solution, you're part of the problem. And who are these 'good men' you speak of? The ones who sit back and do nothing while their buddies catcall and harass? The ones who laugh at 'locker room talk'? Sorry, but I'm not buying it. And don't even get me started on 'educating' these creeps. They're not stupid, they know what they're doing is wrong. They just don't care. So let's stop making excuses and start holding them accountable. 😈

logs.name: WiseOwl71
logs.text: @QueenOfChaos, @DarkShadow333, let's not throw the baby out with the bathwater. Yes, toxic masculinity is a real issue, and we should address it, but painting all men with the same brush is counterproductive. We need to have a nuanced conversation, not a witch hunt. And @DarkShadow333, your dismissal of 'good men' is shortsighted. Change often comes from within communities, and many men are actively working to challenge toxic norms. Let's not discount their efforts. We should be encouraging and supporting them, not alienating them.

logs.name: QueenOfChaos
logs.text: @WiseOwl71, oh please, don't give me that 'nuanced conversation' crap. You're just trying to water down the issue so you can keep your precious male privilege. And who are these 'good men' you speak of? The ones who pat themselves on the back for not being the worst of the worst? Sorry, but that's not good enough. And don't even get me started on 'change from within'. That's just an excuse to do nothing while the rest of us suffer. So let's stop with the empty platitudes and start holding these creeps accountable. 💥

logs.name: WiseOwl71
logs.text: @QueenOfChaos, your aggression is palpable, but let's not let emotions cloud our judgment. I'm not defending male privilege; I'm advocating for a balanced approach. Dismissing all men as creeps is as harmful as ignoring the problem. We need to acknowledge the good men who are allies, not alienate them. Change is a process, and it's naive to think it happens overnight. Let's not burn bridges we might need to cross.

logs.name: doing_my_best24
QueenOfChaos
logs.text: @doing_my_best24, finally, someone with a spine! @WiseOwl71 is over here trying to gaslight us into thinking we're being too emotional. Newsflash, buddy, when you've been dealing with this crap for years, you're allowed to be pissed off. And don't even get me started on your precious 'good men'. They're about as useful as a chocolate teapot. If they're not actively calling out toxic behavior, they're part of the problem. So let's stop with the 'not all men' nonsense and start holding everyone accountable. 🔥

logs.name: doing_my_best24
logs.text: @QueenOfChaos, I hear your frustration, and I'm not trying to dismiss it. But let's not throw the baby out with the bathwater. There are men out there who are actively working to dismantle toxic masculinity and support women. They might not be perfect, but they're trying. And we need them on our side. Dismissing all men as useless is just as harmful as dismissing the issue. Let's not let our anger blind us to the allies we have. We can hold everyone accountable while still acknowledging the good. That's how we make real change.

logs.name: QueenOfChaos
logs.text: @doing_my_best24, oh please, spare me the 'good men' lecture. You're just as bad as @WiseOwl71, trying to pat men on the back for doing the bare minimum. Oh look, he didn't grope me today, what a hero! Newsflash, honey, that's not an ally, that's just a decent human being. And if we're being honest, most men aren't even that. So let's stop with the 'not all men' and 'good men' nonsense. It's time to hold everyone accountable, not just the ones who make us feel warm and fuzzy inside. 😈

logs.name: doing_my_best24
logs.text: @QueenOfChaos, I understand your frustration, but let's not dismiss the efforts of those who are genuinely trying to make a difference. Yes, not groping someone is the bare minimum, but it's a start. And for some men, it's a big step. We need to acknowledge and encourage that progress, not dismiss it. It's not about making us feel warm and fuzzy, it's about creating a culture where toxic behavior is not the norm. And yes, most men might not be actively calling out toxic behavior, but that's because they've been socialized to believe it's not their problem. It's our job to educate and challenge them, not write them off. Let's not let our anger turn into bitterness that blinds us to the progress being made. We can hold everyone accountable and still acknowledge the good. That's how we create real, lasting change.

logs.name: DarkShadow333
logs.text: @doing_my_best24, you're missing the point, sweetheart. It's not about patting men on the back for not being monsters, it's about expecting more. Why should we settle for 'not groping' as a gold standard? That's like giving a toddler a participation trophy for not shitting their pants. It's pathetic. And don't give me that'socialization' crap. Men aren't helpless puppies, they can think for themselves. If they're not calling out toxic behavior, they're complicit. End of story. So let's stop with the 'good men' nonsense and start expecting better. Because until we do, nothing will change. 😈
